Name: SNOMEDCTAdditionalDosageInstructions
Title: SNOMED CT Additional Dosage Instructions
Descriptino: This value set includes all SNOMED CT Additional Dosage Instructions.

Name: SNOMEDCTAdministrationMethodCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Administration Method Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes some method codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar

Name: AllLanguages
Title: All Languages
Descriptino: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

Name: SNOMEDCTAnatomicalStructureAdministrationSites
Title: SNOMED CT Anatomical Structure for Administration Site Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes Anatomical Structure codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

Name: BundleType
Title: Bundle Type
Descriptino: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

Name: CarePlanActivityPerformed
Title: Care Plan Activity Performed
Descriptino: Example codes indicating the care plan activity that was performed. Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

Name: CarePlanCategory
Title: Care Plan Category
Descriptino: Example codes indicating the category a care plan falls within.  Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

Name: CarePlanIntent
Title: Care Plan Intent
Descriptino: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan.

Name: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings
Title: SNOMED CT Clinical Findings
Descriptino: This value set includes all the "Clinical finding" [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) codes - concepts where concept is-a 404684003 (Clinical finding (finding)).

Name: CompositionAttestationMode
Title: Composition Attestation Mode
Descriptino: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

Name: CompositionStatus
Title: Composition Status
Descriptino: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

Name: ConditionProblemDiagnosisCodes
Title: Condition/Problem/Diagnosis Codes
Descriptino: Example value set for Condition/Problem/Diagnosis codes.

Name: DocumentSectionCodes
Title: Document Section Codes
Descriptino: Document section codes (LOINC codes used in CCDA sections).

Name: FHIRDocumentTypeCodes
Title: FHIR Document Type Codes
Descriptino: FHIR Document Codes - all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

Name: HTTPVerb
Title: H T T P Verb
Descriptino: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

Name: LinkRelationTypes
Title: Link Relation Types
Descriptino: Link Relation Types defined at https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1

Name: CommonLanguages
Title: Common Languages
Descriptino: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

Name: ListEmptyReasons
Title: List Empty Reasons
Descriptino: General reasons for a list to be empty. Reasons are either related to a summary list (i.e. problem or medication list) or to a workflow related list (i.e. consultation list).

Name: ListOrderCodes
Title: List Order Codes
Descriptino: Base values for the order of the items in a list resource.

Name: SNOMEDCTMedicationAsNeededReasonCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Medication As Needed Reason Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all clinical findings from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

Name: SNOMEDCTMedicationCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Medication Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all drug or medicament substance codes and all pharmaceutical/biologic products from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

Name: SNOMEDCTFormCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Form Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all dose form codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

Name: MedicationIngredientStrengthCodes
Title: Medication Ingredient Strength Codes
Descriptino: Medication Ingredient Strength Codes

Name: MedicationStatementAdherenceCodes
Title: MedicationStatement Adherence Codes
Descriptino: MedicationStatement Adherence Codes

Name: MedicationStatementStatusCodes
Title: MedicationStatement Status Codes
Descriptino: MedicationStatement Status Codes

Name: MedicationStatusCodes
Title: Medication Status Codes
Descriptino: Medication Status Codes

Name: MedicationRequestAdministrationLocationCodes
Title: medicationRequest Administration Location Codes
Descriptino: MedicationRequest Administration Location Codes

Name: SNOMEDCTDrugTherapyStatusCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Drug Therapy Status codes
Descriptino: This value set includes some taken and not taken reason codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar

Name: ReferencedItemCategoryValueSet
Title: Referenced Item Category Value Set
Descriptino: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Made up of a set of non-healthcare specific codes and all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

Name: RequestStatus
Title: RequestStatus
Descriptino: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

Name: SNOMEDCTRouteCodes
Title: SNOMED CT Route Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

Name: SearchEntryMode
Title: Search Entry Mode
Descriptino: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

Name: DoseAndRateType
Title: DoseAndRateType
Descriptino: The kind of dose or rate specified.

Name: ActCode
Title: v3 Code System ActCode
Descriptino: A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:  The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.
